5) ‚ÄúThe Splurge‚Äù¬†refers to Proposal-Builder Separation for the consensus layer, which separates block production and block verification to allow for centralized block production and decentralized block verification.
‚ÄúThe Purge‚Äù talks about¬†how the danksharding specifications ensure that validators store and guarantee data availability for data they come to consensus on for a few months.
‚ÄúThe Verge‚Äù discusses the need for mandatory history expiry in the protocol level to prevent an ever-increasing state from affecting decentralization.
4) ‚ÄúThe Verge‚Äù¬†and¬†‚ÄúThe Purge‚Äù¬†refer to the state and storage considerations in Ethereum‚Äôs roadmap.
The Proposal-Builder Separation is still a work in progress, and Ethereum community is working to minimize the negative effects of MEV on the network.

This structure eliminates the possibility of frontrunning by validators and incentivizes builders to bid up to the full value of the MEV extracted allowing the decentralized validator set to reap a majority¬† of MEV rewards.
Ethereum aims to mitigate harmful MEV by creating a new builder role that constructs execution payload blocks with user transactions, and submits them along with a bid for proposers to accept.

3) ‚ÄúThe Scourge‚Äù¬†refers to an extra-protocol¬†Maximal Extractable Value(MEV)/marketplace. 

With the introduction of Proposal-Builder Separation for the consensus layer,

2) ‚ÄúThe Surge‚Äù¬†refers to Danksharding, a design space in Ethereum‚Äôs roadmap that combines data availability with the consensus and settlement layer. 

This allows for rollups to utilize native data availability solutions and paves the way for enshrined rollups.

urls.description: Bit Digital is a publicly traded digital asset platform focused on Ethereum-native treasury and staking strategies. The Company began accumulating and staking ETH in 2022 and now operates one of the largest institutional Ethereum staking infrastructures globally. Bit Digital‚Äôs platform includes advanced validator operations, institutional-grade custody, active protocol governance, and yield optimization. Through strategic partnerships across the Ethereum ecosystem, Bit Digital aims to deliver exposure to secure, scalable, and compliant access to onchain yield.

‚ÄúIn the future, Bit Digital may consider expanding its efforts into other leading POS protocols.‚Äù

‚ÄúAt this time, the Company has no plans to offer such solutions to US-based customers, nor to engage in any custodial activities such as ‚Äústaking as a service‚Äù or ‚Äúearn‚Äù programs, nor to offer any staking-related tokens or securities.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe Company targets staking approximately half its total digital asset position.

Beyond this, Bit Digital is exploring incubating additional PoS related businesses, including a joint venture in Singapore to provide ETH staking-related technology tools.‚Äù

‚ÄúBit Digital‚Äôs ongoing strategy is to mine BTC, programmatically convert a portion to ETH, and subsequently stake to generate rewards that can then in turn compound or be redeployed into mining investments and other corporate uses.‚Äù

‚ÄúApproximately 2,164 ETH was actively staked, both in native and liquid protocols. 

The staked portfolio is currently generating an approximately 6% APY.‚Äù

‚ÄúAs of December 31, 2022, the Company held 10,820 ETH and ETH equivalents with a fair value of approximately $12.9 million, primarily acquired through programmatic conversions of BTC mining rewards.‚Äù

In 2022, Bit Digital announced its intention to become a validator on the Ethereum network, and to accumulate and stake Ether (ETH).
